subject: Re: [junit] How to test console output?
msgSnippet: ... 1. Don t use System.out in your application directly. Your application components should accept a PrintWriter as a parameter somewhere. 2. In your tests,
messageBody:
>So said jxingtang on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>I do not know whether this is a duplicated question. I have a program
>with large number of console output from different source. Basically,
>I am using System.out.println(...). How could I verify those outputs
>are correct? Thanks!

1. Don't use System.out in your application directly. Your application components should accept a PrintWriter as a parameter somewhere.
2. In your tests, substitute a PrintWriter wrapping a StringWriter in place of System.out. This is easy to verify.

Take care.
